dcterms:creator: M. L. Littman
dcterms:description: Markov games provide a framework for multi-agent reinforcement learning, allowing for the study of optimal strategies in competitive environments.
dcterms:title: Markov Games (MGs)

dcterms:creator: R. B. Diddigi
C. Kamanchi
S. Bhatnagar
dcterms:description: A generalized minimax Q-learning algorithm designed for two-player zero-sum stochastic games, enhancing the learning process in competitive environments.
dcterms:title: Generalized Minimax Q-learning (G-SORQL)

dcterms:creator: R. B. Diddigi
C. Kamanchi
S. Bhatnagar
dcterms:description: An optimal version of the generalized minimax Q-learning algorithm for two-player zero-sum stochastic games, focusing on achieving optimal strategies.
dcterms:title: Generalized Optimal Minimax Q-learning (G-SOROQL)

dcterms:creator: A. Vijesh
S. R. Shreyas
dcterms:description: A two-step Q-learning algorithm designed to enhance the learning process in Markov decision processes.
dcterms:title: Two-step Q-learning (TMQL)

dcterms:creator: J. Peng
R. J. Williams
dcterms:description: An incremental multi-step Q-learning algorithm that improves the efficiency of learning in reinforcement learning tasks.
dcterms:title: Incremental Multi-step Q-learning

dcterms:creator: J. Fan
Z. Wang
Y. Xie
Z. Yang
dcterms:description: A theoretical analysis of deep Q-learning, focusing on its application in reinforcement learning.
dcterms:title: Deep Q-learning

dcterms:creator: J. PÂ´erolat
B. Piot
O. Pietquin
dcterms:description: An actor-critic approach to fictitious play in simultaneous move multistage games, enhancing strategy learning.
dcterms:title: Actor-critic fictitious play

dcterms:creator: J. Perolat
B. Scherrer
B. Piot
O. Pietquin
dcterms:description: A study on approximate dynamic programming techniques applied to two-player zero-sum Markov games.
dcterms:title: Approximate dynamic programming for two-player zero-sum Markov games
